name: Notation in Different Disciplines
description: Exploring how mathematical notation is used across various scientific and technical fields.

cards.title: Scientific Notation & Large Numbers
cards.description: Learning how to represent very large and very small numbers efficiently.
bulletpoints: Scientific notation follows the form: \[ a \times 10^n \], where \( 1 \leq a < 10 \) and \( n \) is an integer.
Convert between standard form and scientific notation using exponent rules.
Common applications in physics, astronomy, and engineering for handling extreme values.

cards.title: Engineering & Physics Notation
cards.description: Understanding specialized notation used in physics and engineering equations.
bulletpoints: Common physics symbols: \[ F \] (force), \[ v \] (velocity), \[ a \] (acceleration), \[ E \] (energy)
SI unit notation: \[ m \] (meters), \[ kg \] (kilograms), \[ s \] (seconds).
Greek letters in science: \[ \lambda \] (wavelength), \[ \sigma \] (summation), \[ \mu \] (micro)

cards.title: Probability & Statistics Notation
cards.description: Exploring symbols used in probability and statistical analysis.
bulletpoints: Probability of event \( A \): \[ P(A) \].
Mean (\( \mu \)), variance (\( \sigma^2 \)), and standard deviation (\( \sigma \))
Factorial notation: \[ n! = n \times (n-1) \times \dots \times 1 \]
Combinations and permutations: \[ {}_nC_r = \frac{n!}{r!(n-r)!} \], \[ {}_nP_r = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!} \]

cards.title: Calculus & Mathematical Analysis Notation
cards.description: Understanding how differentiation and integration are represented mathematically.
bulletpoints: Derivative notation: \[ f'(x) \], \[ \frac{dy}{dx} \], \[ \frac{\partial f}{\partial x} \] (partial derivative)
Integral notation: \[ \int f(x) \,dx \] for indefinite and \[ \int_{a}^{b} f(x) \,dx \] for definite integrals.
Limits notation: \[ \lim_{x \to a} f(x) \]

cards.title: Linear Algebra & Matrix Notation
cards.description: Exploring vector and matrix notation used in computational mathematics and physics.
bulletpoints: Vector notation: \[ \mathbf{v} = (v_1, v_2, v_3) \].
Matrix representation: \[ A = \begin{bmatrix} a_{11} & a_{12} \\ a_{21} & a_{22} \end{bmatrix} \]
Determinant: \[ \det(A) \], inverse matrix: \[ A^{-1} \]

cards.title: Set Theory & Logical Notation
cards.description: Understanding the foundational notation of mathematical logic and set relations.
bulletpoints: Set membership: \[ x \in A \] (x is an element of A)
Union and intersection: \[ A \cup B \], \[ A \cap B \]
Logical symbols: \[ \wedge \] (AND), \[ \vee \] (OR), \[ \neg \] (NOT), \[ \forall \] (for all), \[ \exists \] (exists)

cards.title: Quantum Mechanics & Bra-Ket Notation
cards.description: Exploring Dirac's notation for quantum states and operators.
bulletpoints: Quantum state notation: \[ \langle \psi | \] (bra), \[ | \psi \rangle \] (ket)
Operator action: \[ \hat{A} | \psi \rangle = \lambda | \psi \rangle \]
Probability amplitudes and eigenvalues in quantum mechanics.

cards.title: Computer Science & Algorithm Notation
cards.description: Studying notations used in computational complexity and algorithm design.
bulletpoints: Big-O notation for algorithm efficiency: \[ O(n) \], \[ O(\log n) \], \[ O(n^2) \]
Logic gate notation: \[ A \wedge B \] (AND), \[ A \vee B \] (OR), \[ \neg A \] (NOT)
Lambda calculus notation: \[ \lambda x.f(x) \] for functional programming.

cards.title: Electrical Engineering & Circuit Notation
cards.description: Understanding symbolic representations in circuit analysis and electromagnetism.
bulletpoints: Ohm's Law: \[ V = IR \] (voltage = current Ã— resistance).
Circuit components: \[ R \] (resistor), \[ C \] (capacitor), \[ L \] (inductor)
Maxwell's equations: \[ \nabla \times E = -\frac{\partial B}{\partial t} \]
